title.rendered: Our Favorite Creative Guest Book Ideas

content.rendered:
SIGN HERE

OUR FAVORITE GUEST BOOK ALTERNATIVES

It's no secret that a wedding guest book is a must-have. There is nothing more special than having a personal piece of memorabilia to commemorate your special day. Especially one that is filled with sweet notes and well wishes from each and every one of your guests!

These days, we are seeing an influx of super creative and uniquely personal alternatives to the traditional wedding guest book. Pen and bound paper be gone! Couples are opting for something that speaks to who they are as a couple and something that is a little more exciting to sign than your average book.

We've rounded up a list of our favorites from real weddings below. Scroll on to get your own creative juices flowing!

1. CUSTOM PRINTS

Have your guests sign custom prints to commemorate your day. Choose a print that fits your personal style, and then have it framed to display in your home.

Credits: Nesting Project & Details Nashville, Art Prints Vicky & Sarah Swain Photography, Hatch Show Print & Erin Lee Allender.

2. ADVICE CARDS

Instead of just signing their names, have your nearest and dearest leave some wishes and words of advice. Read them now or save them for later! On your one year anniversary while you're pulling out the top tier of your wedding cake, read through the tips together to share some laughs and maybe a few tears.

Credits: Laura K. Allen Photography, CK Photo, SheHeWe Photography.

3. RECORDS

If you're a music lover like many of us in Music City, have your guests sign your favorite records. Display them later along with your impressive music collection.

Credits: Details Nashville.

4. GUITAR

Music obsessed, but want something you can more prominently display than records? Let guests leave their mark by signing a guitar.

Credits: Details Nashville.

5. CUSTOM CANVAS

This couple said "I do" right before a hot air balloon ride. During the reception, guests signed a custom canvas keeping with the theme of the day.

Credits: Lane Photography.

6. KEYS TO SUCCESS

Similar to advice cards, we love this fun way to learn the keys to a successful marriage. Have your family and friends share their tips on paper tags attached to old keys.

Credits: Krista Lee Photography.

7. GLOBE

The perfect guest book alternative for the world-traveling couple.

Credits: Taylor Lord.

8. WOOD DISPLAY

Much like custom canvas art, a hand-painted wood sign is also a great albeit more rustic way to commemorate your big day and display in your home.

Credits: Steph Sorenson, Anna Rebecca.

9. ATLAS

This jet-setting couple centered their wedding day around travel. In lieu of a traditional guest book, their guests flipped through an atlas and wrote a note next to their favorite vacation spot. This gave them plenty of ideas for future travel destinations!

Credits: Caley Newberry.

10. TREE ILLUSTRATION

Guests sign their name on each branch of the tree, creating the illusion of leaves and pine cones. The finished product is sweet piece of art to frame and display.

Credits: SheHeWe Photography.

excerpt.rendered: Our top ten favorite unique guest book alternatives from real weddings.
